Chad,
If you went to the cemetary with H.Analyst, I probably know which one=

you went to.
There are some not so nice things that happen at that cemetar=
y.....
Deb

________________________________

From: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com=
 [mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf
Of Zack Widup
Sent: Monday, Aug=
ust 18, 2008 10:31 AM
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Un=
expected aspects of the 469




I haven't experienced the EVP/ITC, but many=
 cemeteries have guardians
that 
try to ward you off in various ways. From =
my experience, if they finally

decide you're not there to do harm they wil=
l kind of back off and leave 
you alone.

A simple thing like straightening=
 a skewed tombstone or cleaning up a
mess 
will convince them you're not th=
ere to harm. Also, tell them that you're

not there to do damage.

Zack

On=
 Mon, 18 Aug 2008, Chad wrote:

> Just wondering if you guys have ever expe=
rienced anything like what
> I'm about to describe.
>
> I was doing an inve=
stigation at a cemetery the other night. My
> girlfriend was using the 469 =
with headphones. It started to spook her
> a little and she gave me the box=
. I put in the headphones and didn't
> hear anything out of the normal radi=
o scan. Then I heard footsteps
> circling me. I started looking around and =
asked if anyone else was
> hearing them. I then got attacked by an entity i=
n the cemetery. It
> felt a lot like a schoolyard bully circling you before=
 he hits you,
> and then a big rush of energy. I can't really describe the =
feeling.
>
> Then, the other night I was on a separate investigation and wa=
s in a
> bathroom. I was hearing water dripping, but when I checked the
> p=
ossible sources they were bone dry.
>
> Is it possible that these noises ca=
n come clearly through the 469? I
> do not have any psychic ability I know =
of. They are very real, and are
> definitely happening, not being imagined.=
 Maybe it has something to do
> with the headphones? I cannot explain this.=
 Have any of you had a
> similar experience?
>
>
